intro: Ornithogalum cepaceum, commonly known as the common star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, cylindrical stems and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are long, narrow, and grass-like, often forming a rosette at the base. Ornithogalum cepaceum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
